str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be faint, be weary. From ek and kakos; to be weak, i.e. to fail.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To destroy, waste; hence met: I corrupt. From diaballo and phtheiro; to rot thoroughly, i.e. to ruin.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Within, inside, with verbs either of rest or of motion; prep: within, to within, inside. From eis; inside.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To renew, make new again. From ana and a derivative of kainos; to renovate.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
